alert.note: Alert for Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 4:49PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Lee County through 530 PM CST... At 449 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fedor, or 10 miles south of Lexington, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Tanglewood, Fedor, Hills, Leo, Lincoln, Manheim, Blue and Old Dime Box. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
